feature.name: SaaSquatch Program Development CLI
feature.description:
The SaaSquatch program dev CLI aims to improve the workflow of a program developer by automating
    the process of uploading code/schemas to Webtask and Contentful.

featureElements.name: Sensitive information will be loaded through environment variables

steps.text: I have installed the CLI
the CLI loads and begins executing
if a .env file is found in the current working directory it will be loaded
the environment variables will store the sensitive information

featureElements.name: Users can log in via the CLI

steps.text: I have just installed the CLI and want to log in
I have accounts on Contentful and Webtask with the proper access rights
I use the command `login`
I will be prompted and the appropriate web pages will open in the browser
I will be prompted to login and paste the access tokens in the CLI
the CLI will store the tokens in a configuration file in my home directory
I have installed the CLI and logged in
I use the command `logout`
my tokens will be deleted from the configuration file

featureElements.name: Users can select whether to use the staging or production environment

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in with the `login` command
I use the command `space`
I will be prompted to select the Contentful space I want to use
the options will be either 'Product (TEST)' or 'Product (LIVE)'
I select one of the two options
the option I selected will be stored in the configuration file

featureElements.name: The environment must be selected before making a deployment

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have not yet configured the environment
I use the command `deploy`
the CLI will not deploy the program
I will be asked to set the environment before continuing

featureElements.name: The CLI will issue a clear warning when deploying to production

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have set the space to 'Product (LIVE)'
I use the command `deploy`
the CLI will print a warning on the screen & confirm that I want to continue

featureElements.name: The user must be logged in to make a deployment

steps.text: I have installed the CLI
I am not logged in
I use the command `deploy`
the CLI will not deploy
the CLI will prompt me to log in

featureElements.name: The CLI will automatically determine which files to upload

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have set the environment
I have two files, <programName>.js and <programName>_schema.json
I use the command `deploy <programName>.js`
the CLI will determine the name of the schema file to be <file>

featureElements.name: The CLI will not run if it cannot determine the other file to upload

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have set the environment
I have two files, <programName>.js and <programName>.json
I use the command `deploy <programName>.js`
the CLI will not be able to determine the schema file to upload
the CLI will prompt the user to name their files correctly

featureElements.name: The `deploy` command must be passed the Webtask file, not the schema file

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have set the environment
I have two files, <programName>.js and <programName>_schema.json
I use the command `deploy <programName>_schema.json`
the CLI will not be able to make the deployment
the CLI will prompt the user to upload the .js file instead

featureElements.name: The `deploy` command will determine the Contentful entry ID automatically

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have set the environment
I have two files, programName.js and programName_schema.json
I use the command `deploy programName.js`
the CLI will obtain a list of entries from Contentful
if the CLI finds an entry with matching name, summary, and description
the CLI will upload the schema to that entry
if the CLI does not find a match
the CLI will prompt the user to enter the entry ID manually

featureElements.name: The `deploy` command will choose the name of the Webtask automatically

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have set the environment to <environment>
I have two files, <programName>.js and <programName>_schema.json
I use the command `deploy <programName>.js`
the CLI will choose the name of the Webtask as <name>

featureElements.name: The `deploy` command will determine the required NPM modules automatically

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have set the environment
I use the command `deploy`
the CLI will scan the Webtask file for `require` statements
the CLI will automatically update the NPM modules in webtask according to what it finds

featureElements.name: The `deploy` command will only upload if the files have changed

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I have set the environment
I have two files, programName.js and programName_schema.json
I have made changes to <files>
I use the command `deploy programName.js`
the CLI will only upload <files>

featureElements.name: I can stream the Webtask logs to the console

steps.text: I have installed the CLI and logged in
I use the command `logs`
the Webtask log stream will be outputted on the console
